Ascend the Throne of Gaming with the Z790 AERO G. The Z790 AERO G supports 13th and 12th Gen Intel Core Processors unparalleled performance. Unlock your gaming potential with GIGABYTE Z790 Motherboards. GIGABYTE Z790 motherboards come with upgraded power design, high grade storage standards, and outstanding connectivity that enables you to optimize your performance. Claim what is yours.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.1 4.1 out of 5 stars 33 ratings 4.1 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Excelente funcionando con procesador i5 14600k ram ddr5 5600mhz. Maquina

reviews.reviewerName: luis Eduardo Herrera Ramirezluis Eduardo Herrera Ramirez
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Excelente producto calidad precio. Muy recomendable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars First one arrived damaged, second failed to POST
reviews.reviewText: The first gigabyte board I have ever ordered. The board arrived with the cpu socket cover floating around in the anti-static bag and multiple socket pins were already damaged. It's the first damaged board upon receipt in my 25 years of building PCs. There were no seals on the product box. Hard to believe it could have made it through QA like that.I immediately submitted a return for refund upon receving and opening it. I'm disappointed but I'll try one more time for this model because it's one of the better options for a z790 with a pcie 5.0 m.2 slot.Update: the second one arrived and wouldn't POST. Returned it for refund again.I bought an ASUS board and now everything is working with the same components I tried on the gigabyte board. I really wanted to try a brand other than ASUS but it just didn't work out this time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic - High Mid Range Board - Heat Transfer King
reviews.reviewText: This is 1-2 steps below the very top end of MBs. My reasons for buying the Aero were 5x M.2 drives, DDR5 and heat transfer. Historically I only bought ASUS drives, this one is very well made. Solid, does not bend. The bios update was quick and painless using QFLASH. I couldn't be happier. Running latest Intel 5 13900k.Looks just fantastic. I preferred the aluminum look.. Get a great case and time your RGB fans and it is just incredible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Could have been better
reviews.reviewText: I have been building gaming desktops for years. I tend to favor Asus and Gigabyte mother boards. The first thing I noticed was that the manual and the drivers disc where both missing. I contacted the seller who indicated that this is how the item came from the factory. Cost cutting? In defense of Gigabyte, the item did look like it was previously opened so your experience may be different. I was able to download the latest drivers and the manual from the Gigabyte website and so I could continue with my build.The next challenge involved the cooler for the CPU which was hitting the heat sink for the M.2 drive. I’m not sure how Gigabyte missed this – unless they expect you to buy some custom CPU cooler. This was almost a deal breaker until I noticed this MB supports both types of M.2 drives and I had the PCIe type which connected elsewhere on the MB. Still the heat sink needed to be removed to allow the CPU cooler sufficient space to be installed properly. If you have a SATA M.2 SSD then removing this heatsink is not an option for you. Instead you can probably cut the top of it off to provide just enough clearance for the CPU cooler. I doubt this will reduce its cooling capacity too much – I haven’t tried this so cannot say for sure.Lastly, the BIOS is reasonably intuitive for standard setups. Autoconfig properly detected all my hardware, drives, fanes, memory, etc. If you want to fiddle with the more advanced settings this can be a little tricky but there is more information to be found on the internet. I was annoyed by an alert to install Gigabyte Control Center which kept coming up each time I rebooted. There was a checkbox to disable the alert but it did nothing. I have noticed that Asus and Gigabyte are generally pretty good at designing the MB – they are not so good at designing software. I have always had far more problems with their monitoring and software so now I never install them; only the MB drivers get installed. This alert can also be disabled in the BIOS, under settings. This is what the internet says and this is what Gigabyte support says. What they don’t tell you is that this option is buried deeply. I had trouble trying to locate it. Fortunately there was a search option which is how I managed to find it. Search for "Gigabyte Utilities Downloader Configuration".Now my PC is working great and the M.2 SSD (Samsung) is really fast.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No built in internet drivers.
reviews.reviewText: This product does not have LAN, or WiFi network adapter drivers built into it, so you have to use a different computer with internet to transfer the drivers to the new pc, but the drivers don't work with my pc, so I can't access the internet with this motherboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Ok Board, Useless with memory over 5200mhz
reviews.reviewText: This board will work fine with 4 sticks of DDR5 up to 5200mhz but anything higher and it's super buggy. Here's an example:I bought 4 sticks of DDR5-6000. I enabled XMP in the bios along with changing the VDDQ settings to 1.40v like in numerous forums and videos I've watched. The PC will then boot into Windows just fine. Everything is stable. Games are fine. As soon as I do a restart I get a boot failure message. If I shut down instead of reboot the PC will continue to boot up fine but the minute I go to reboot it will not boot back up until I clear the BIOS. Turning memory fast boot on and off does nothing. These kinds of bugs are what is going to keep me away from Gigabyte motherboards from now on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It’s crazy to me how the listing says new but my product was used and had marks on it and it seem like other people had the same experience as me.

Tarjeta madre bastante completa, con un diseño moderno y buena refrigeración, estoy ejecutándola con un procesador i5-13600KF y 32 GB de RAM DDR5, el CPU, SDD y la RAM se reconocieron de inmediato, el diseño de la BIOS es bastante agradable, actualizarla con Q-FLASH a su ultima versión fue muy rápido y sencillo, de igual forma la configuración de los perfiles XMP, también posee un Códec de Audio ALC1220-VB que hace mucho la diferencia en la calidad del audio respecto a las versiones anteriores. Me preocupaba un poco la altura del disipador de calor para PCIe 5 NVMe, pero logré instalar un enfriador de CPU bastante voluminoso Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 SE en modo PUSH/PULL perfectamente y sin problemas.Mi único descontento fue con la instalación de los controladores restantes de la placa, tuve que hacerlo con una tarjeta de red USB inalámbrica aparte, por que los controladores Ethernet y WIFI de la antena externa que incluye, simplemente no estaban presentes después del formateo, los que están en la página oficial de Gigabyte marcan un error de que se instalaron incorrectamente y posteriormente no los reconoce, investigue y algunas placas con el Chipset Z790 están teniendo el mismo problema, al final se soluciono instalando todas las actualizaciones de Windows y ya fueron reconocidos.

reviews.reviewTitle: Expensive motherboard offcourse but a beautiful one.
reviews.reviewText: It is as efficient as it's beauty.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works in the way it should. No issues.
reviews.reviewText: It works properly for me. No issues. I appreciate the dedicated BIOS USB port.
